Class TSP

      SolutionState solve(int timeLimit, int bound)
      Searches for a tour in graph lower than bound and tries to prove its optimality in less than timeLimit milliseconds.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TSP

        public TSP(Graph graph)

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        public SolutionState solve(int timeLimit,
                           int bound)
        Searches for a tour in graph lower than bound and tries to prove its optimality in less than timeLimit milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        timeLimit - a limit of CPU time in milliseconds
        bound - an upper bound on the total cost of the tour
        Returns:
        NO_SOLUTION_FOUND, if no tour lower than bound has been found within timeLimit milliseconds,
        SOLUTION_FOUND, if a tour lower than bound has been found, but its optimality has not been proven within timeLimit milliseconds,
        OPTIMAL_SOLUTION_FOUND, if a tour lower than bound has been found, and its optimality has been proven,
        or INCONSISTENT, if there does not exist a tour lower than bound.

      • getNext

        public int[] getNext()
              throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns:
        an array next such that next[i] gives the vertex visited just after i in the last computed solution
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If this.getSolutionState() not in {SOLUTION_FOUND, OPTIMAL_SOLUTION_FOUND}

      • getTotalCost

        public int getTotalCost()
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns:
        the total cost of the last computed solution
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If this.getSolutionState() not in {SOLUTION_FOUND, OPTIMAL_SOLUTION_FOUND}

      • getSolutionState

        public SolutionState getSolutionState()
        Returns:
        NO_SOLUTION_FOUND if no solution has been found during the last call to solve,
        SOLUTION_FOUND if a solution has been found during the last call to solve but its optimality has not been proven,
        OPTIMAL_SOLUTION_FOUND if a solution has been found during the last call to solve, and its optimality proven,
        INCONSISTENT if the last call to solve has proven that the problem does not have a solution.
